headline: Leadbeater's possum  in pictures
text: It is estimated that there are just 1,500 of the tiny possums in pockets of the central highland forests of VictoriaPhotograph: Steve Kuiter       There are fears they may become extinct within a decade if their habitat is not conserved Photograph: Dan Harley       It has been Victorias faunal emblem since 1968 Photograph: guardian.co.uk       It was thought to be extinct following bushfires in 1939  Photograph: Steve Kuiter       The species was rediscovered by Eric Wilkinson, a 22-year-old Melbourne Museum worker on his first field trip, in 1961 Photograph: Dan Harley
